intro: Ceraia dentata, commonly known as the toothed ceraia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. Ceraia dentata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
